definition: lit. contribute bricks and tiles for a building (idiom)/fig. to do one's bit to help
to add/to increase/to replenish
brick/CL:塊|块[kuai4]
variant of 磚|砖[zhuan1]
variant of 甎|砖[zhuan1]
abbr. for Canada 加拿大[Jia1 na2 da4]/surname Jia

to add/plus/(used after an adverb such as 不, 大, 稍 etc, and before a disyllabic verb, to indicate that the action of the verb is applied to sth or sb previously mentioned)/to apply (restrictions etc) to (sb)/to give (support, consideration etc) to (sth)
roof tile/abbr. for 瓦特[wa3 te4]

sentences.english: Adding to the language's standard functionality was very difficult.
sentences.chinese: 要为这个语言的标准功能添砖加瓦简直是难如登天。

sentences.english: Knowledge is a city, to the building of which every human being brought a stone.
sentences.chinese: 知识是座城宇，人人都应为之添砖加瓦。

sentences.english: You want to know how you can grease the process in your favor.
sentences.chinese: 你会想知道怎样才能给面试的效果添砖加瓦。

sentences.english: We have a good foundation but we need to build on it.
sentences.chinese: 我们有不错的基础，但还需要添砖加瓦。

definition: to win an honor/to strive to win a prize
a helping hand/help/assistance
to benefit (e.g. the people)
(slang) to cheer sb on/to show one's support/("call" is pronounced approximately like English "call")
(idiom) to safeguard (sth)/to protect (sth)
to lend a helping hand (idiom)
lit. to fly upwards swiftly/fig. rapid advance/rapidly developing (situation)
(aerospace) to boost/booster (rocket)/(behavioral economics) to nudge
a foundation stone/a cornerstone
to wave flags and shout battle cries (idiom); to egg sb on/to give support to
to continue the struggle (idiom); to persist/unremitting efforts
to compose (a piece of music)/(fig.) to create, by one's actions, a narrative (generally one that can be recounted with pride)
great effort/to strive/to try hard
to advance bravely/to endeavor
to work energetically for prosperity (of the country)
to follow the past and herald the future (idiom); part of a historical transition/forming a bridge between earlier and later stages
